form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cornynintroduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To withhold the salary of the Director of OMB upon failure to submit the President’s budget to Congress as required by section 1105 of title 31, United States Code.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Budget, No OMB Pay Act of 2013 .

section.header: Determination of compliance with statutory requirement to submit the President's budget
section.text: Not later than 3 days after the President's budget is due, the Inspector General of theOffice of Personnel Managementshall—

paragraph.text: make an annual determination of whether the Director of theOffice of Management and Budget(OMB) and the President are in compliance with section 1105of title 31, United States Code; and

provide a written notification of such determination to the Chairpersons of theCommittee on the Budgetand theCommittee on Appropriations of the Senateand the Chairpersons of theCommittee on the Budgetand theCommittee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives.

section.header: No pay upon failure to timely submit the President’s budget to congress

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no funds may be appropriated or otherwise be made available from the United States Treasury for the pay of the Director ofOMB,Deputy Director of OMB, and theDeputy Director for Management of OMBduring any period of noncompliance determined by the Inspector General of theOffice of Personnel Managementundersection 2.

The Director ofOMB,Deputy Director of OMB, and theDeputy Director for Management of OMBmay not receive pay for any period of noncompliance determined by theInspector General of the Office of Personnel Managementundersection 2at any time after the end of that period.

section.text: This Act shall take effect upon the date of enactment of this Act.
